strapiPost.title: KUAF Celebrates 50 Years Of Public Broadcasting
strapiPost.content:
KUAF 91.3FM has provided 24/7 coverage of invaluable news, information, and culture to people across Northwest Arkansas and the surrounding region for fifty years!

  • Timeless and timely: The radio station began in 1973 as a low-powered radio station on the University of Arkansas campus and has since grown its coverage to a 14-county area, including parts of Arkansas, Oklahoma, and Missouri as the only source of national and international news from NPR as well as a daily local program Ozarks at Large.
  • On the airwaves: KUAF broadcasts various locally produced programs, podcasts, and musical performances that amplify authentic voices on critical issues, share insights from diverse cultures, and create space for meaningful dialogue.

You can support public radio by listening or donating to KUAF 91.3 online HERE.
